image.altText: The backs of a woman and a man looking at a body of water.

props.synopsis: A judge has handed down the largest fine ever under the NT’s sacred site laws after a sensitive men's site was damaged at Gunlom Falls in Kakadu National Park.

title.children: Gunlom Falls to reopen to tourists after historic fine handed down over sacred site damage

image.altText: Multiple boats in ocean including Border Force patrol boat and small illegal fishing vessel

props.synopsis: Saibai Islanders say they have been left to "fend for themselves" as confrontations over illegal fishing expose flaws in border security, putting their livelihoods and safety at risk.

title.children: Islanders left to defend Australian border warn 'someone will get hurt' unless government acts

image.altText: Older indigenous men stand behind a wide gate labelled Kinchela Boys Home

props.synopsis: The 49 Indigenous survivors from Kinchela Boys Home want to turn the site into a museum and place of healing as they mark 100 years since the institution began operations.

title.children: Stripped naked, heads shaved and given a number to replace their name. Survivors of boys home share their stories

image.altText: Young women's face with sunglasses on her head

props.synopsis: One in four women will experience pain during sex that can affect their self-worth and their relationships. These people say pelvis floor specialists can improve women's lives.

title.children: Sex was 'unbearable' for Daisy until she went to see a physiotherapist

image.altText: A woman hides her face in the fur of a dog, short hair, sun glasses on top.

props.synopsis: A regional domestic violence service says the time to rehome women and children has more than doubled since last year amid the national housing crisis.

title.children: This DV survivor secured a house after sleeping rough for 18 months with her children. She is one of the lucky ones

image.altText: a close up of carroll

props.synopsis: Queensland's former police commissioner has been accused of striking a deal with the state's powerful police union not to release "damaging reports" they commissioned in the belief the service did not "need more bad press", according to an internal email seen by the ABC.

title.children: 'I couldn't unsee what I saw': Officers involved in unreleased review of pilot program to transform Queensland Police speak out

image.altText: A brown snake rearing up with it's mouth open, on red grassy soil.

props.synopsis: A toxicologist warns it's never safe to assume a snake bite is free of venom, after a South Australian man experiences a delayed reaction to poison from a suspected brown snake bite.

title.children: Snake bite victim's 'unusual' 15-hour wait before venom kicks in

image.altText: A woman looks sternly at the camera.

props.synopsis: Crystal's baby was born in jail while she waited for her case to be processed. Her wait for justice is not uncommon in the NT, where the courts are so backlogged that unprecedented numbers of people are being left to languish on remand.

title.children: Crystal's newborn son spent his first 10 months in prison, while she waited almost a year on remand

image.altText: a photo of a man in a suit speaking with a building in the background

props.synopsis: As the NT government brings tough new public drinking measures to parliament, an independent politician is urging Aboriginal people sleeping rough to consider leaving town centres.

title.children: Aboriginal politician warns people sleeping rough to go bush or risk jailtime under tough new laws

image.altText: Bullet holes are seen on the front of a Toyota minibus

props.synopsis: Residents of Papua New Guinea's Porgera region say they're fearful a "new brand of tribal warfare" has started after gunmen stormed a passenger bus, killing at least six people.

title.children: Fears 'any innocent person travelling' could be murdered in PNG region after bus mass shooting

image.altText: Still from CCTV of a woman in a pinkl singlet reaching out to a baby being held by its mother

props.synopsis: A 21-year-old woman is charged after she allegedly assaulted a baby in a random attack at a Perth shopping centre.

title.children: Toddler allegedly assaulted by woman in random shopping centre attack suffers facial injuries

image.altText: aerial shot of melbourne showing houses and city skyscrapers

props.synopsis: Though it might feel like we've been stuck in the same housing debate forever, in the last two years there has been a quiet revolution.

title.children: Fighting about skyscrapers at train stations is the surest sign the housing debate has shifted

image.altText: A child in front of a pile of rubble.

props.synopsis: The economic impact of Israel's campaign to remove Hamas from Gaza has wrought "unparalleled destruction" as nearly all Palestinians live in poverty, the UN says.

title.children: Economic recovery from the 'utter ruin' of Israel's invasion of Gaza would take centuries, UN says

image.altText: A close up of a young woman with long dark hair

props.synopsis: Matilda Campbell, 23, has thanked the rescue team who saved her life after she slipped trying to retrieve her mobile phone in the NSW Hunter Valley. She came out of the ordeal with a fractured vertebra and grazes.

title.children: Woman who spent seven hours hanging by her feet in rock crevice 'eternally thankful' for rescue

image.altText: A white streak across a city scape.

props.synopsis: Social media reports of fireballs lighting up the night sky seemingly pop up very regularly — just this week hundreds of people saw one over the US and Canada. Are they becoming more frequent or are we just better at catching them?

title.children: Seen a super bright meteor? Fireballs are set to become more common as space junk drops from the sky

image.altText: A man walks through journalists and cameras.

props.synopsis: Bruce Lehrmann is able to appeal against the result of his failed defamation case, after a Federal Court judge dismissed an application for him to pay a security of costs before any appeal goes ahead.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann cleared to proceed with defamation case appeal

image.altText: A headshot of a serious-looking woman with short dark hair.

props.synopsis: Lovisa Sjoberg, 48, has not been seen for more than a week. Police were alerted to her disappearance when she failed to return a vehicle she had hired.

title.children: Rental car found in search for 'avid photographer' missing for more than a week in NSW Snowy Mountains

image.altText: Senator Matt Canavan. June 22, 2021

props.synopsis: One of the Coalition's staunchest anti-abortion advocates has rejected calls for the issue to become a federal election fight, saying the temperature needs to be turned down on a "really sensitive issue for people".

title.children: One of the Coalition's staunchest anti-abortion advocates says it shouldn't be a federal election issue

image.altText: Linda in her garden potting a basil plant an a small outdoor table with pink flowers in the foreground.

props.synopsis: A survey finds around three-quarters of retirees with a mortgage owe more than they have in superannuation. More people are facing their retirement years with a home loan and the trend is expected to continue as the age of first home buyers rises.

title.children: 'Bank of mum and dad' becoming a 'really critical factor' affecting how many Australians will retire

image.altText: A man's leg with a purple rash on it.

props.synopsis: Doctors say scurvy, best associated with sailors' lack of fresh fruit and vegetables on long sea voyages, is a "re-emerging diagnosis" — partly due to cost-of-living pressures.

title.children: Australian man diagnosed with scurvy, a disease doctors 'thought we had eradicated'

image.altText: A woman and man with sunglasses.

props.synopsis: The judge in the trial for a teenager accused of the home-invasion murder of Brisbane woman Emma Lovell has retired to consider his verdict.

title.children: Widower of Brisbane mother speaks of 'difficult' trial as judge retires to consider verdict in murder case

image.altText: Eminem wears a hoodie and holds a microphone as he raps on a stage.

props.synopsis: Kamala Harris is looking to her celebrity backers for a tie-breaking boost as the American presidential election campaign enters its final fortnight.

title.children: Eminem, Springsteen join Kamala Harris campaign as Democrats seek celebrity boost in deadlocked race

image.altText: Andrea Solonge, a Black woman smiling with formal dress on at an event

props.synopsis: Sydney actor Andrea Solonge has been announced as the winner of the 12th Heath Ledger scholarship. Solonge has appeared in the Stan series Prosper and in Taika Waititi's Apple TV+ series Time Bandits.

title.children: Sydney actor Andrea Solonge is the winner of the 12th Heath Ledger scholarship

image.altText: Muslim students kneel to pray in the atrium at Swinburne University Hawthorn campus.

props.synopsis: Students have been locked out of a Swinburne University campus' prayer room on Islam's main day of worship after a clash over who should lead services.

title.children: 'It makes you feel unwelcome': Prayer room closed after dispute between Muslim students and university

image.altText: Lidia Thorpe yelling wearing a fur cloak.

props.synopsis: In this fracturing world where the ability of politicians to command mainstream attention is in decline — the events of this week have been a good demonstration of what works.

title.children: Lidia Thorpe's King Charles protest was heard around the world for the same reason we're not talking about aged care

image.altText: The wreckage of a small plane in smouldering bushland.

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to a property south-west of Rockhampton this morning. The 30-year-old pilot freed himself from the wreckage and is in a stable condition.

title.children: Pilot escapes fiery plane crash in rural Queensland

image.altText: Mickey the cockatoo in Macarthur Square Shopping Centre walking towards a trolley

props.synopsis: A cockatoo named Mickey became trapped inside Macarthur Square Shopping Centre at Campbelltown in Sydney's south-west last month. He "took up residence" at the Coles supermarket before he was captured by local bird expert yesterday.

title.children: 'She helped me lure him': How bird expert captured cockatoo stuck in supermarket for weeks

image.altText: Madeline Gordon prepares to throw a pass

props.synopsis: After being stunned in the Constellation Cup opener by the Silver Ferns, the Diamonds are facing an uphill task in game two in New Zealand. Follow live.

title.children: Diamonds rocked in first half as Silver Ferns continue Constellation Cup dominance in New Zealand

image.altText: Onesmoothoperator ridden by Craig Williams wins the Geelong Cup

props.synopsis: Onesmoothoperator has announced himself as a contender for Australia's most famous horse race after claiming the Geelong Cup.

title.children: Onesmoothoperator wins Geelong Cup as favourite is pulled up by jockey

image.altText: Ezra Mam pictured in action for the Broncos in 2024

props.synopsis: Newly-installed Broncos coach Michael Maguire has spoken publicly for the first time on the future of his star five-eighth, who awaits the club's decision on his future.

title.children: Broncos coach reveals 'one thing' Ezra Mam must do after involvement in car crash

image.altText: Cameron Wurf touches his watch while running

props.synopsis: Australian veteran Cameron Wurf is going to be one of the oldest elite athletes to start the Ironman World Championships in Kona. He believes he can't be ruled out.

title.children: He may be one of the oldest on the Kona start line, but Aussie Cam Wurf says age is just a number

image.altText: Art Simone wearing a blue vinyl trenchcoat dress studded with silver spikes and a blue wig and fingernails.

props.synopsis: Early in Art Simone's career she would source costumes from the $2 shop and perform in small clubs in Melbourne. Now she's performing on the world stage — but her passion still lies in promoting drag in Australia.

title.children: From sourcing costumes in the $2 shop to custom-made gowns, Art Simone shares the money secrets of a drag queen

image.altText: Household money pic

props.synopsis: The IMF's revised forecasts for Australian inflation now match the Reserve Bank's forecasts. Is that a story?

title.children: Stop the presses! The IMF's forecasts for Australia's inflation now match the Reserve Bank's

image.altText: An image of a computer screen.

props.synopsis: A new bulk extortion email campaign threatening to reveal sensitive images and videos of Australians is best ignored, says the National Anti-Scam Centre.

title.children: Scam watchdog says bulk extortion emails claiming hacked pictures and videos is a 'fictional threat'

image.altText: An older man in a cap and a high-vis shirt rests a garden tool over his shoulder while standing outdoors.

props.synopsis: Raymond George Brownlowe is facing five charges and has been remanded in custody over the alleged kidnapping on August 23.

title.children: No bail for 70-year-old accused of kidnapping teenager at gunpoint and detaining her overnight
